Articles.Content: I made a Mun Base :3
What engine(s) did you use to land it?

6 LV-909 Liquid fuel Engines with 1 FL-T400 fuel tank per engine attached with radial decouplers. There's actually a ring of spent engines around the base that you can't see

If you're interested, here's the craft file.

http://www./download/w2y6qadzz2dfy6h/Luna_Colony_Mark_2_6.craft

Be warned, this thing is a pain to try and land. To save wieght, I didn't add an SAS module to the actual base, which makes it hard to control.

NOTE: Please take my words with a grain of salt. I'm very inexperienced in KSP and my pre-frontal cortex hasn't fully developed, which makes me prone to bad decisions in speech.

I didn't add an SAS module to the actual base, which makes it hard to control.

You're such a ding-dong. An SAS doesn't weigh much and it's extremely useful. What's next, you gonna tell me no RCS? Oh wait, I can't see any.

NOTE: Please take my words with a grain of salt. I'm very inexperienced in KSP and my pre-frontal cortex hasn't fully developed, which makes me prone to bad decisions in speech.

You're such a ding-dong. An SAS doesn't weigh much and it's extremely useful. What's next, you gonna tell me no RCS? Oh wait, I can't see any.

Haha! x) I am a ding-dong. You're right, saying SAS adds too much weight was just my justification for being too lazy to change the design.

As for the RCS, the base itself is nimble enough that I didn't really need any. Although the entire launch vehicle could definately use a lot of improvement.
